docs.snippet: Destiny's Darlings, the New York Mets, went skedaddling into the World Series yesterday in their usual preposterous and improbable fashion. They survived their sudden-death, fifth-game playoff against the Cincinnati Reds, presumably a superior bal...
docs.lead_paragraph: Destiny's Darlings, the New York Mets, went skedaddling into the World Series yesterday in their usual preposterous and improbable fashion. They survived their sudden-death, fifth-game playoff against the Cincinnati Reds, presumably a superior ball club. But no one in the insane and wildly emotional crowd at Shea Stadium asked to inspect Redleg credentials. They just went crazy the split second the game had ended.
